alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Pope; Stevens (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 14 at 9:16PM CST until February 15 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Douglas, Stevens and Pope Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to as low as one quarter mile. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of moderate snow will occur late evening and overnight as winds increase steadily and gust as high as 55 mph. A flash freeze and whiteout conditions are likely.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
